CatDescriptText: C.W. Hall, 1924 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "I only know of one incident in the city and this was revealed a short time ago in a hearing in the City County before the zoning committee.  The incident concerned an Italian Presbyterian..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of C. W. Hall wearing eyeglasses, light colored shirt, dark necktie, and light colored jacket, standing in front of Liberty Photo Supply, Wood Street, Downtown
